description: Add a sqrt button with text '√' to the right of the clear button; click it to calculate the result using the display content directly.
Add a square button with text '^2' to the right of the sqrt button.
Add a reciprocal button with text '1/x' to the right of the square button.
Add a sin button with text 'sin' after all the buttons.
Add a π button with text 'π' to the right of the sin button; click the π button to replace the display content.
Reverse the positions of the sin and π buttons, with no change to other buttons.
Change the 'clear' button width to 3 columns.
Add a toggle button with id 'toggle' to change the theme between dark and light modes; the toggle button's text is 'dark' when in light mode and 'light' when in dark mode.
Move the toggle button to the bottom-center of the page.
Change the default theme to dark.

Add a button with id 'mode' near the toggle button to change the mode between scientific (default) and basic; its text is 'basic' in scientific mode and 'scientific' in basic mode; basic mode only displays the first 5 rows of the button panel.
Make the last button of the first 5 rows in the button panel have a brighter background color; consider both dark and light modes.
Fix the display input width to be equal to the button content width; change the display input CSS properties as little as possible.
Add buttons for cos, tan, sinh, and cosh at the end of the button panel.

Add a MemoryPlus button (text 'M+') at the end to add the display content and store the data; add a MemoryRecall button (text 'MR') before the M+ button to append the stored data to the display content.
Display stored data in a panel (id 'memory') next to the button panel in the calculator in scientific mode.
Show the latest 5 clicked button texts in a history panel (id 'clicks') next to the memory panel in scientific mode.
Add a MemoryMinus button (text 'M-') next to the M+ button to subtract the display content and store the data.
Add a MemoryClear button (text 'MC') next to the M- button to reset the stored data to 0.
Click an item (class 'history-item') in the history panel to perform the same action as clicking the calculator button.
